messages: ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:42): can't remember whether he's already commented that his objection to the alt="{...}" proposal (in that it makes it hard to write reliably-correct HTML-generating tools) could be fixed by permitting it in the alt-is-actually-a-proper-equivalent cases as well as the alt-is-just-a-description cases

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:42): which would mean conforming pages using alt="{...}" would be ambiguous, but that's okay because it's going to be ambiguous in reality anyway and this won't make it any worse
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:43): So, anyway, if I hadn't commented on that, then at least I have now

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:44): well, I hope I got them all. I relied on the probability of all of them being sent at least once within 100 separate requests for the page

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:59): btw, if anyone else wants to participate in a DDoS against 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67, here's the script :-)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:59): do wget -O $i.html http:/ 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67oetmer.nl/irc-logs/?gimme-a-hobby;
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:59): cat * | grep ^\<p | sort | uniq > all.txt
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:59): cat all.txt | wc -l
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (20:59): Thanks for ruining my fun ;)
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (21:00): You need to add a captcha or something

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:01): I was just bored, and wanted to practice my skills with writing bash scripts, which I started learning recently
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (21:01): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: the bash script I wrote to help teach myself is ugly
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (21:01): but I have proven that it is possible to write a BFS in bash
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (21:02): It's also possible to bang your head against the wall

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:02): is that right?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:03): the bug with my script is that it doesn't stript <p><b> tags from the lines. Is that possible to do with grep, or some other utility?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:04): ok, I'll have to learn sed later
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (21:04): No idea if it's possible, I don't use it that much

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:33): notes he doesn't have 200 EUR
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:34): notes that stripping stuff from lines ia a major use case for sed
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:38): for example
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:38): obviously ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c will have an easier way :)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:39): perl -pe's~<p><b>(.*)</b></p>~$1~'
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:40): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: I don't know how the subtitle gets chosen but you should put in a few with a low probability like 1 in 1000
